text:
Hi all, Tom here from the HubSpot forms team. 

Just a heads up. Recently we pushed a change moving the domain that loads form definitions from <http://forms.HubSpot.com|forms.HubSpot.com> to <http://forms.hsforms.com|forms.hsforms.com>. This change was to improve security on our forms and to provide a greater consistency across our tools. 
We are seeing some cases come up where forms are failing to load due to a server only allowing specific domains to load within their content security policy. If you have specific domains setup on your website’s content security policies, we would advise you add <http://forms.hsforms.com|forms.hsforms.com> to these domains to ensure your HubSpot forms can load correctly. 
Thanks!
I'm creating a redirect 301 in HubSpot. My original URL is /bcn and I want this to redirect to /speakers-bcn18 however it's not being redirected at all. Any ideas what's wrong ?

Thank you SO much for communicating this with the community <@U7Q9HPCTE>! Communication on changes, updates, and potential breaking is an area we're really trying to improve on... it means a lot to these developers who manage the downstream effects of your team's updates. Please keep these coming my friend :slightly_smiling_face: :raised_hands:

Found an issue with the follow me social settings 

You can’t add custom links that have a path.
<https://spin.d.pr/i5G2Lp+>

It just made more work out of something really simple.

I would think it would also prevent most people from adding any social networks that HS doesn’t yet support as you typically always need the path to identify the account
opted to build my own follow me CM to solve the problem.
check the priority setting on the redirect and if anything existing redirects could conflict
if another one conflicts and the priority doesn’t trump it, then it wont work as you expect.
Mcoley has the need for speed. :rocket:
